Job Title: Supervisor, Commercial Operations

Location: Rancho Dominguez, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Company Overview:

If a culture of excellence, innovation and ownership is what you’re searching for, consider putting your experience in motion at Flowserve. As an individual contributor, or as a leader of people, your enterprise mindset will ensure Flowserve’s position as the global standard in comprehensive flow control solutions. Here, your opportunity for professional development and industry leading rewards will be supported by our foundational commitments to the values of people first, integrity and safety. Thinking beyond opportunity and reward, at Flowserve, we are inspired by working together to create extraordinary flow control solutions to make the world better for everyone!

Flowserve is a world-leading manufacturer and aftermarket service provider of comprehensive flow control systems. Driven by our Purpose, we are committed to building a more sustainable future to make the world better for everyone. With more than 16,000 employees in more than 50 countries, we combine our global reach with local presence. We support more than 10,000 customers worldwide, creating products to meet the needs of our customers who are supplying energy, fresh water, pharmaceuticals and other essentials to consumers, businesses and governments globally.

Join a company where the people challenge themselves to approach each situation with ingenuity and creativity to help provide our customers with the most innovative flow control products and services. You will be part of a team known for its industry-leading talent, unparalleled portfolio, and unmatched commitment to customer success. Flowserve’s culture promotes recognition and rewards creativity, hard work, and commitment. We invite you to put your talents and career in motion at Flowserve.

Summary:

The role of the Supervisor is to be a player/coach. This includes driving the responsiveness of their assigned Commercial Operations team to enable us to grow bookings overall. While maintaining a responsibility for some quoting activity, this position will be responsible for building a highly responsive and customer driven group.

The group will be focused on providing our Flowserve sales organization, customers, distributors, and 3rd party representative channel partners the most technically sound and competitive quotation solutions for all pertinent inquiries in addition to transferring to our operations complete and correct order entry files for execution.

Responsibilities:

For pre-defined accounts, the Supervisor will be responsible for the review of RFQs and the issuance of quotes for the products that this person supports.Drive timely responsiveness to all viable quotation opportunities. This includes tracking the response time of the Commercial Operations team based on agreed upon standards.Manage the review of all valve and actuation orders for completeness and correctness, and assist in resolving any issues to insure proper order entry.Proper order entry to include clean Order Transfer files that are provided to Order Management in the agreed upon time frame.Coordinate and approve commercial terms of purchase orders and/or contracts including SAP generation and approval along with the resolution of any respective terms and conditions issues, based on Flowserve guidelines.Implement and oversee a continual training program to insure team members are properly applying their technical expertise and commercial knowledge during quotation preparation.Are updated on our techniques for utilizing any of the respective configurators / sizing and selection tools required for proposal generation.Are learning to apply our best practices in sizing, selecting and quoting the best suited Flowserve FCO products.Ensure applicable industry standards are applied correctly.Any schools conducted at the operation are well coordinated, informative and beneficial to all attendees (Flowserve direct or 3rd party sales personnel)

Team Members are being developed to continuously enhance and improve performance.

Work closely and develop strong business relationships with the key members of our operations, sales and engineering management teams to help drive the success of our FCO organizationContinually analyze and track the results of our pricing and quotation practices, including the generation of win / loss quotation hit rates to enhance our effectivenessTrack, monitor, and review the performance of your individual direct reports through our performance management review process, including assigning measurable goals and focused accountabilities. Monitor the progress of each team member throughout the year per our HR guidelines and processes.Work closely with our outside sales organization to enhance our communication, project pursuit, collaboration, and overall selling efforts.Comply with Flowserve goals, objectives and policies and manage your respective team members to adhere to the same standards.Other duties as assigned.

Requirements:

BS or BA Degree in relevant field and 5–7 years relevant experienceSuccessful inside / outside sales experienceKnowledge and experience serving the variety of process control markets associated with the assigned products and / or region.Excellent oral and written communication skills.Strong interpersonal and organizational skills.Detailed oriented.Proven track records of completing assignments as requested and in a timely manner.Basic knowledge of commercial issues including payment terms, shipping terms, and contract review.Computer skills including Microsoft Office, Internet along with the ability and willingness to learn how to use other or new business software packages as required by the role.

Preferred Experience / Skills:

Project Management experience is a plus.

Benefits:

Flowserve offers competitive pay, annual bonuses, medical benefits on day 1, generous paid vacation time, paid holidays, 401(k) and many other excellent benefits!

Base Pay Range: 116,755.93–145,944.92–175,133.90 USD Annual

Req ID : R-9645

Job Family Group : Sales

Job Family : SA Commercial Operations

EOE including Disability/Protected Veterans. Flowserve will also not discriminate against an applicant or employee for inquiring about, discussing or disclosing their pay or, in certain circumstances, the pay of their co-workers. Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access flowservecareers.com as result of your disability. You can request a reasonable accommodation by sending an email to employment@flowserve.com. In order to quickly respond to your request, please use the words "Accommodation Request" as your subject line of your email. For more information, read the Accessibility Process.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
